intro: Tulista spiralis, commonly known as the spiral tulip, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of petals, which gives it a unique and ornamental appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. Tulista spiralis prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its botanical features make it a popular choice among horticulturists and garden enthusiasts.
